Detailed Description

template<class DataType, class OIDType = int>
class stBasicStringObject< DataType, OIDType >

This class template implements an string object that can be indexed by all metric trees in this library.

This object holds a null terminated string of some type and a OID. The OID may be used to hold an additional information about the object (like the primary key in a database) and will never be used by the distance functions.

The template parameter DataType defines the data type of each unit of the array. It may be any C/C++ standard numeric types (integers, characters and floating points). The template parameter OIDType defines the type of the OID to be used. As DataType, it may assume any numeric type. By default, it will always be and int value.

The Serialized version of this class is organized as follows:
+-----+------+
| OID | Data |
+-----+------+

Since Data has a variable size (associated with the string object), the serialized form will also have a variable number of bytes.

This class template was designed to work with the metric evaluators defined in stBasicMetricEvaluators.h.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Fabio Jun Takada Chino (chino@icmc.usp.br)

Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvieira@icmc.usp.br)

template<class DataType, class OIDType = int>
stBasicStringObject< DataType, OIDType >::stBasicStringObject (   )  [inline]
 

Default constructor. It creates an array with 0 elements. Use SetSize() to change the number of entries before use this instance.

This constructor is required by the stObject interface.

Definition at line 434 of file stBasicObjects.h.

template<class DataType, class OIDType = int>
const stByte* stBasicStringObject< DataType, OIDType >::Serialize (   )  [inline]
 

This method must create a serialized version of this instance. The serialized version is an array of bytes that will hold all information required to rebuild this object. For example, if the object is a string, the serialized form may be the string itself without the terminator character (since it is a sequence of bytes).

This array will be used by the SlimTree to store the object into a disk page and to recover it (by calling Unserialize()) and its size given by GetSerializedSize().

The effect of the of A->Unserialize(B->Serialize(), B->GetSerializedSize()) must be the same of A=B->Clone().

Implementation note: The SlimTree will not claim the ownership of the returned array. The object must dispose it when it is not required. In case of the serialized version be a pointer to an internal array, no copy operation will be necessary.

Returns:
The serialized version of this object.
See also:
GetSerializedSize()

Unserialized()

Note:
This method is required to fulfil the stObject interface.

Definition at line 484 of file stBasicObjects.h.

Referenced by stBasicStringObject< DataType, OIDType >::stBasicStringObject().

template<class DataType, class OIDType = int>
void stBasicStringObject< DataType, OIDType >::Unserialize (  const stByte *  data,
stSize  dataSize
)  [inline]
 

This method must rebuild the object from its serialized version. The serialized version is an array of bytes that holds all information required to rebuild an object. For example, if the object is a string, the serialized form may be the string itself without the terminator character (since it is a sequence of bytes).

This method will be used by the SlimTree to rebuild the object to compare it with another object (the sample object in a query or another rebuilt object).

The effect of the of A->Unserialize(B->Serialize(), B->GetSerializedSize()) must be the same of A=B->Clone().

Implementation note: The SlimTree is the owner of the data array. This means that this array may vanish at any time after the call of Unserialize(). There is also another restriction. The Unserialize() method must never modify the contents of the data array.

Parameters:
data The serialized object.
datasize The size (in bytes) of the data array.
See also:
Serialized()
Note:
This method is required to fulfil the stObject interface.
